sentence: Figure 1 represents the change in weight as a function of age with a LOESS smoothed line by LLM status, and Appendix 3 graphically depicts by sex.

The presence of low lean mass was defined using the Foundation of the National Institute of Health Sarcopenia guidelines (appendicular lean mass [ALM]:body mass index [BMI]<0.789 in men; <0.512 in women)[2].Figure 1: Change in Weight by Low Lean Mass Status (Appendicular Lean Mass:BMI).
